required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of RoActemra/Actemra (Tocilizumab) in Patients With Moderate to Severe Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Local Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Tocilizumab in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis on Background Non-biologic DMARDs Who Have an Inadequate Response to Current Non-biologic DMARD

brief_summary.textblock: This open-label study will evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of RoActemra/Actemra (tocilizumab) in patients with moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) on background non-biologic DMARDs who have an inadequate response to current non-biologic DMARDs. Patients will receive 8 mg/kg RoActemra/Actemra as an intravenous infusion every 24 weeks for a total of 6 infusions. The anticipated time on study treatment is 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Percentage of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse /Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. A serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. An AE was considered treatment emergent if the date of onset of the AE was on or after the date of first dose of study medication. AEs of special interest included Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (MACE) (including strokes), infections, and infusion reactions. An AE was considered an infection if the preferred term was in the predefined infection AE group term. A serious infection was an infection which was also considered as an AE. An AE was considered an infusion reaction if it occurred during or within 24 hours of an infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With All-Cause Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who discontinued treatment due to any reason were included in this measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Alanine Transaminase (ALT) and Asapartate Transaminase (AST) Elevations of Greater Than (>) 1.5 Upper Limit of Normal (ULN), >3 ULN and > 5 ULN
secondary_outcome.description: Elevations in ALT and AST could indicate hepatotoxicity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With ALT and AST Elevations of >1.5 ULN, >3 ULN and > 5 ULN
secondary_outcome.description: Elevations in ALT and AST could indicate hepatotoxicity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Serious Infections
secondary_outcome.description: A serious infection was an infection which was also considered as an SAE. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Infections
secondary_outcome.description: A serious infection was an infection which was also considered as an SAE. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Highest Values for ALT and AST
secondary_outcome.description: Elevations in ALT and AST could indicate hepatotoxicity. These enzymes were measured as International Units per Liter (IU/L). The change from baseline was calculated as: baseline value minus the highest value observed post-baseline for each enzyme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Highest Values for Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL) and Total Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Elevations in LDL and total cholesterol could lead to heart disease. The change from baseline was calculated as: baseline value minus the highest value observed post-baseline and was measured as milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Lowest Value for Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC)
secondary_outcome.description: ANC is a measure of number of neutrophil granulocytes. An ANC less than 500 cells per microliter (cells/µL) is defined as neutropenia and significantly increases risk of infection. The change from baseline was calculated as: baseline value minus the highest value observed post-baseline. ANC was measured in cells/µL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Elevations in Lipids According to Adult Treatment Panel (ATP) III Guidelines
secondary_outcome.description: ATP III guidelines classify LDL cholesterol >160 mg/dL, Total cholesterol >240 mg/dL, High Density Lipoprotein (HDL) >60 mg/dL and Triglycerides (TG) >199 as elevated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Elevations in Lipids According to ATP III Guidelines
secondary_outcome.description: ATP III guidelines classify LDL cholesterol >160 mg/dL , Total cholesterol >240 mg/dL, HDL >60 mg/dL and TG >199 as elevated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Clinically Meaningful Improvement in Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS28) At Every Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA). The index includes swollen and tender joint counts, acute phase response, and general health status. The DAS28, which uses a 28 joint count, is derived from the original DAS. The index is calculated using the following formula: DAS28 = 0.56 x (TJC28)^0.5 + 0.28 x (SJC28)^0.5 + 0.70 x In(ESR) + 0.014 x GH Where TJC28 = tender joint count on 28 joints, SJCz8 = swollen joint count on 28 joints, ın = natural log, ESR = erythrocyte sedimentation rate and GH = general health (participant's global assessment of disease activity). DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity. A score of less than (<) 2.6 represents clinical remission, a score of: <3.2 represents low disease activity (LDA), and a score of > 5.1 represents severe disease. A reduction from previous visit of at least 1.2 units in DAS28 is considered to be a clinically meaningful improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Clinically Meaningful Improvement in DAS28 At Every Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in RA. The index includes swollen and tender joint counts, acute phase response, and general health status. The DAS28, which uses a 28 joint count, is derived from the original DAS. The index is calculated using the following formula: DAS28 = 0.56 x (TJC28)^0.5 + 0.28 x (SJC28)^0.5 + 0.70 x In(ESR) + 0.014 x GH Where TJC28 = tender joint count on 28 joints, SJCz8 = swollen joint count on 28 joints, ın = natural log, ESR = erythrocyte sedimentation rate and GH = general health (participant's global assessment of disease activity). DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity. A score of < 2.6 represents clinical remission, a score of: < 3.2 represents LDA, and a score of > 5.1 represents severe disease. A reduction of at least 1.2 units from previous visit in DAS28 is considered to be a clinically meaningful improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20, ACR 50, ACR 70 and ACR 90 Response
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20/50/70/90 response: greater than or equal to (≥) 20/50/70/90 percent (%) improvement in TJC; ≥20/50/70/90% improvement in SJC; and ≥20/50/70/90% improvement in at least 3 of 5 remaining ACR core measures: participant assessment of pain; participant global assessment of disease activity; physician global assessment of disease activity; self-assessed disability (disability index of the Health Assessment Questionnaire [HAQ]); and C-Reactive Protein (CRP). Improvements were assessed on the basis of prior visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR 20, ACR 50, ACR 70 and ACR 90 Response
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20/50/70/90 response: ≥ 20/50/70/90 % improvement in TJC; ≥20/50/70/90% improvement in SJC; and ≥20/50/70/90% improvement in at least 3 of 5 remaining ACR core measures: participant assessment of pain; participant global assessment of disease activity; physician global assessment of disease activity; self-assessed disability (disability index of the Health Assessment Questionnaire [HAQ]); and C-Reactive Protein (CRP). Improvements were assessed on the basis of prior visit. .

secondary_outcome.measure: C-Reactive Protein Levels
secondary_outcome.description: CRP is an inflammatory marker used to measure inflammation in RA and is measured as mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate
secondary_outcome.description: ESR is an inflammatory marker used to measure inflammation in RA and is measured as millimeters per hour (mm/hr).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Tender and Swollen Joints
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked to classify 28 joints as tender or not tender and swollen or not swollen to count the total number of tender and swollen joints by visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's (PT) and Investigator's (IN) Assessment of Disease Activity
secondary_outcome.description: VAS is a visual scale of 100 mm for the assessment of disease activity by participants or investigator. Disease activity/pain increases while approaching 100 mm. For the screening visit (baseline visit) there's only investigator assessment data, for other visits participant's pain assessment, participant's disease activity assessment and investigator's disease activity assessment parameters were collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Assessment of Pain
secondary_outcome.description: VAS is a visual scale of 100 mm for the assessment of disease activity by participants or investigator. Disease activity/pain increases while approaching 100 mm. For the screening visit (baseline visit) there's only investigator assessment data, for other visits participant's pain assessment, participant's disease activity assessment and investigator's disease activity assessment parameters were collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Assessment Questionnaire Score (General Score)
secondary_outcome.description: The Stanford HAQ disability index is a participant completed questionnaire specific for RA. It consists of 20 questions referring to 8 component sections: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and activities. The questionnaire was provided in validated translation into the local languages at the participating sites and was scored. Every question in each section was scored at a scale from 0 to 3 by the participant where 0 = able to perform the activity without any difficulty and 3 = unable to perform the activity. General score was calculated as an average of the 8 sections.

intervention.description: 8 mg/kg intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/=18 years of age
- Moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthritis (DAS28>/=3.2) of >/=6 months duration
- Body weight </=150 kg
- Patients are on one or more non-biologic DMARDs at a stable dose for a period >/=8 weeks prior to study treatment
- Patients with inadequate clinical response to a stable dose of non-biologic DMARD
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major surgery (including joint surgery) within 8 weeks prior to screening or planned major surgery within 6 months following randomization
- Rheumatic autoimmune disease other than rheumatoid arthritis, including systemic lupus erythematosus, mixed connective tissue disease, scleroderma, polymyositis, or significant systemic involvement secondary to rheumatoid arthritis
- History of or current inflammatory joint disease other than rheumatoid arthritis

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 Milligrams Per Kilogram (mg/kg)
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). Participants received tocilizumab monotherapy if they were not tolerating current Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) and those who tolerated DMARDs were on the same regimen of tocilizumab in combination with their non-biologic DMARDs.

baseline.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population consisted of all participants included in the study who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). Participants received tocilizumab monotherapy if they were not tolerating current DMARDs and those who tolerated DMARDs were on the same regimen of tocilizumab in combination with their non-biologic DMARDs.

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Safety: Percentage of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse /Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. A serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. An AE was considered treatment emergent if the date of onset of the AE was on or after the date of first dose of study medication. AEs of special interest included Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (MACE) (including strokes), infections, and infusion reactions. An AE was considered an infection if the preferred term was in the predefined infection AE group term. A serious infection was an infection which was also considered as an AE. An AE was considered an infusion reaction if it occurred during or within 24 hours of an infusion.
outcome.population: The safety population consisted of all participants included in the study who received at least one dose of study medication and who had at least one post-baseline assessment of safety (that is post-baseline laboratory data, vital signs or adverse events).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Elevations in Lipids According to Adult Treatment Panel (ATP) III Guidelines
measure.description: ATP III guidelines classify LDL cholesterol >160 mg/dL, Total cholesterol >240 mg/dL, High Density Lipoprotein (HDL) >60 mg/dL and Triglycerides (TG) >199 as elevated.
measure.population: Safety population; Number (n) equals (=) number of participants analyzed at the specified visit for the given parameter.

outcome.description: ATP III guidelines classify LDL cholesterol >160 mg/dL , Total cholesterol >240 mg/dL, HDL >60 mg/dL and TG >199 as elevated.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Elevations in Lipids According to ATP III Guidelines
measure.description: ATP III guidelines classify LDL cholesterol >160 mg/dL , Total cholesterol >240 mg/dL, HDL >60 mg/dL and TG >199 as elevated.
measure.population: Safety population; n = number of participants analyzed at the specified visit for the given parameter.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Achieved Clinically Meaningful Improvement in Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS28) At Every Visit
outcome.description: The DAS28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA). The index includes swollen and tender joint counts, acute phase response, and general health status. The DAS28, which uses a 28 joint count, is derived from the original DAS. The index is calculated using the following formula: DAS28 = 0.56 x (TJC28)^0.5 + 0.28 x (SJC28)^0.5 + 0.70 x In(ESR) + 0.014 x GH Where TJC28 = tender joint count on 28 joints, SJCz8 = swollen joint count on 28 joints, ın = natural log, ESR = erythrocyte sedimentation rate and GH = general health (participant's global assessment of disease activity). DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity. A score of less than (<) 2.6 represents clinical remission, a score of: <3.2 represents low disease activity (LDA), and a score of > 5.1 represents severe disease. A reduction from previous visit of at least 1.2 units in DAS28 is considered to be a clinically meaningful improvement.
outcome.population: Intent- to- Treat (ITT) Population: all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study medication. Number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome and n = participants who were evaluable for specified category

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). Participants received tocilizumab monotherapy if they were not tolerating current DMARDs and those who tolerated DMARDs were on the same regimen of tocilizumab in combination with their non-biologic DMARDs.

DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity. A score of less than (<) 2.6 represents clinical remission, a score of: <3.2 represents low disease activity (LDA), and a score of > 5.1 represents severe disease. A reduction from previous visit of at least 1.2 units in DAS28 is considered to be a clinically meaningful improvement.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Achieved American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20, ACR 50, ACR 70 and ACR 90 Response
outcome.description: ACR20/50/70/90 response: greater than or equal to (≥) 20/50/70/90 percent (%) improvement in TJC; ≥20/50/70/90% improvement in SJC; and ≥20/50/70/90% improvement in at least 3 of 5 remaining ACR core measures: participant assessment of pain; participant global assessment of disease activity; physician global assessment of disease activity; self-assessed disability (disability index of the Health Assessment Questionnaire [HAQ]); and C-Reactive Protein (CRP). Improvements were assessed on the basis of prior visit.
outcome.population: ITT population; number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). outcome.title: C-Reactive Protein Levels
outcome.description: CRP is an inflammatory marker used to measure inflammation in RA and is measured as mg/dL.

outcome.population: ITT population; number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome and n = participants who were evaluable for specified category

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). Participants received tocilizumab monotherapy if they were not tolerating current DMARDs and those who tolerated DMARDs were on the same regimen of tocilizumab in combination with their non-biologic DMARDs.

measure.title: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate
measure.description: ESR is an inflammatory marker used to measure inflammation in RA and is measured as millimeters per hour (mm/hr).
measure.population: ITT population; number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome and n = participants who were evaluable for specified category

outcome.title: Mean Number of Tender and Swollen Joints
outcome.description: Participants were asked to classify 28 joints as tender or not tender and swollen or not swollen to count the total number of tender and swollen joints by visit.
outcome.population: ITT population

outcome.title: Participant's (PT) and Investigator's (IN) Assessment of Disease Activity
outcome.description: VAS is a visual scale of 100 mm for the assessment of disease activity by participants or investigator. Disease activity/pain increases while approaching 100 mm. For the screening visit (baseline visit) there's only investigator assessment data, for other visits participant's pain assessment, participant's disease activity assessment and investigator's disease activity assessment parameters were collected.
outcome.population: ITT population

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). Participants received tocilizumab monotherapy if they were not tolerating current DMARDs and those who tolerated DMARDs were on the same regimen of tocilizumab in combination with their non-biologic DMARDs.

measure.title: Participant's Assessment of Pain
measure.description: VAS is a visual scale of 100 mm for the assessment of disease activity by participants or investigator. Disease activity/pain increases while approaching 100 mm. For the screening visit (baseline visit) there's only investigator assessment data, for other visits participant's pain assessment, participant's disease activity assessment and investigator's disease activity assessment parameters were collected.
measure.population: ITT population

outcome.title: Health Assessment Questionnaire Score (General Score)
outcome.description: The Stanford HAQ disability index is a participant completed questionnaire specific for RA. It consists of 20 questions referring to 8 component sections: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and activities. The questionnaire was provided in validated translation into the local languages at the participating sites and was scored. Every question in each section was scored at a scale from 0 to 3 by the participant where 0 = able to perform the activity without any difficulty and 3 = unable to perform the activity. General score was calculated as an average of the 8 sections.
outcome.population: ITT population

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg (not more than 800 mg) intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for 24 weeks (total of 6 infusions). Participants received tocilizumab monotherapy if they were not tolerating current DMARDs and those who tolerated DMARDs were on the same regimen of tocilizumab in combination with their non-biologic DMARDs.

measure.title: Health Assessment Questionnaire Score (General Score)
measure.description: The Stanford HAQ disability index is a participant completed questionnaire specific for RA. It consists of 20 questions referring to 8 component sections: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and activities. The questionnaire was provided in validated translation into the local languages at the participating sites and was scored. Every question in each section was scored at a scale from 0 to 3 by the participant where 0 = able to perform the activity without any difficulty and 3 = unable to perform the activity. General score was calculated as an average of the 8 sections.
measure.population: ITT population

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
